column4: does anyone know why my signal strength is really low on ubuntu?
I am connected to the correct netowrk if thats what you mean
no its not the signal. Windows was at almost 100%
but im using the windows driver with ndiswrapper
is this a fresh install or you had it a while and always been low?
is your wireless card listedin the restricted drivers?
re-check the restricted hardware drivers section ...
so the box there is empty? and do you have restricted  enabled in Software Sources?
System > Admin..> Software Sources, go thru all the tabs and enable all but the "CD Rom..." stuff
then reload and run the updater
after you make changes in Sources, it "reloads" the list of updates
try this in a terminal,   sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade sources.list

well, you may have to use the ndiswrapper after all, and that is always "if-fy" I have to go for now, but I'll do some research - you can always find me in #seaphor, and others there that can help too, sorry but time for me to go
you still here? look at this- http://madwifi-project.org/wiki/Compatibility/D-Link
